notesStmt.note: Damp at head in part. Usage stains. Ink partly fading.

Censored by Gio[vanni] Dom[eni]co [Carretto?], Italian censor (active 1600-1624): inscribed with his name, 1602 (folio 211v); see 100-101, and appendix § 80-84. Censored by Cristoforo [...]: inscribed with his name, 1592 (folio 2r). Yehudah ben Mordekhai of Blanis: inscribed, folio 3v.Folios 206r-212r contain a series of entries recording the preformance of berit milah on various occasions, and the birth of children. Some of the entires are in Italian. Folio 2r contains a list of names for kadish prayer, in Italian semi-cursive script of the 16th century.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 122: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum: inscribed, folio [214v] (fse002v).
